Macros

#define BSP_OSAL_WAIT_FOREVER   (0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Wait forever.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_NO_WAIT   (0x00000000U)
 No wait.
 
Lists of bitmask cache types
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L1P   (0x1U)
 Cache Type is L1I (or L1P)
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L1D   (0x2U)
 Cache Type is L1D.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L1   (BSP_OSAL_CT_L1P | BSP_OSAL_CT_L1D)
 Cache Type is L1.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L2P   (0x4U)
 Cache Type is L2I (or L2P)
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L2D   (0x8U)
 Cache Type is L2D.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_L2   (BSP_OSAL_CT_L2P | BSP_OSAL_CT_L2D)
 Cache Type is L2.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_ALLP   (BSP_OSAL_CT_L1P | BSP_OSAL_CT_L2P)
 Cache Type is ALLI (or ALLP)
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_ALLD   (BSP_OSAL_CT_L1D | BSP_OSAL_CT_L2D)
 Cache Type is ALLD.
 
#define BSP_OSAL_CT_ALL   (0x7FFFU)
 Cache Type is ALL.

Detailed Description

BSP OS abstraction layer header file.

Parameters

UInt32 BspOsal_getSystemStackUsage ( void  )

Returns the system stack used in bytes by interrupts.

Returns
System stack usage

Note: This can't be called from HWI/SWI context.

UInt32 BspOsal_getTaskStackUsage ( BspOsal_TaskHandle  tskHandle)

Returns the stack used in bytes by the task represented by the handle passed. If the handle is NULL, it uses the current task context from which this function is called.

Parameters
tskHandlePointer to the task handler
Returns
Task stack usage
Note
This can't be called from HWI/SWI context.

This API is used to initilize BSP OSAL parameters.

void BspOsal_irqXbarConnect ( UInt32  xbarInstance,
UInt32  intSource 
)

Connect the XBAR instance associated with an interrupt.

Dynamically connects the XBAR instance associated with an interrupt on the current core to the selected interrupt source.

Parameters
xbarInstanceXBAR instance number (1-8) For EVE Cores (1-64) For DSP Cores (1-57) For M4 Cores (1-152) For A15 Cores
intSourceIRQ crossbar input index
Returns
None
void BspOsal_irqXbarConnectIrq ( UInt32  cpuIrqNum,
UInt32  intSource 
)

Make a XBAR connection for the given IRQ number.

Dynamically connects the XBAR instance associated with the given IRQ number on the current core to the selected interrupt source. Please note that IRQ number is same as Event Id on C66 DSP.

Parameters
cpuIrqNumCPU's IRQ number
intSourceIRQ crossbar input index
Returns
None
void BspOsal_irqXbarDisconnect ( UInt32  xbarInstance)

Disconnect the XBAR instance associated with an interrupt.

Dynamically disconnects the XBAR instance associated with an interrupt on the current core by clearing the interrupt source index.

Parameters
xbarInstanceXBAR instance number (1-8) For EVE Cores (1-64) For DSP Cores (1-57) For M4 Cores (1-152) For A15 Cores
Returns
None
void BspOsal_irqXbarDisconnectIrq ( UInt32  cpuIrqNum)

Disconnect the XBAR connection associated with the given IRQ number.

Dynamically disconnects the XBAR instance associated with the given IRQ number on the current core by clearing the interrupt source index. Please note that IRQ number is same as Event Id on C66 DSP.

Parameters
cpuIrqNumCPU's IRQ number
Returns
None

)

Parameters

prioritypriority of new task
stackpointer ti memory used for stack

tskAffinitytask affinity
Returns
task handler BspOsal_TaskHandle, NULL otherwise
